svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
February 18, 2023" date: "2023-02-18"
Eth News and Links
Shapella (Shanghai + Capella) upgrade
* Latest all core devs - execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko & Christine
Kim : Empty block handling bug found on Zhejiang testnet, since patched by Geth,
doesn’t impact Sepolia testnet upgrade timeline withdrawal-devnet-7: upgraded to
Shapella with 600k validators and 360k BLS changes, only stopped finalizing for 1 epoch
in a harsher setup than mainnet withdrawal-mainnet-shadowfork-2 to test MEV-Boost 0
blob EIP4844 transactions banned for now Discussions on SSZ in block header, CL minimal
presets (test configs), standardizing transaction pool API and approach to deprecate
SELFDESTRUCT
Latest all core devs - execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko & Christine
Kim :
* Empty block handling bug found on Zhejiang testnet, since patched by Geth, doesn’t
impact Sepolia testnet upgrade timeline
Empty block handling bug found on Zhejiang testnet, since patched by Geth, doesn’t
* withdrawal-devnet-7: upgraded to Shapella with 600k validators and 360k BLS changes,
only stopped finalizing for 1 epoch in a harsher setup than mainnet
withdrawal-devnet-7: upgraded to Shapella with 600k validators and 360k BLS changes,
* withdrawal-mainnet-shadowfork-2 to test MEV-Boost
withdrawal-mainnet-shadowfork-2 to test MEV-Boost
* 0 blob EIP4844 transactions banned for now
0 blob EIP4844 transactions banned for now
* Discussions on SSZ in block header, CL minimal presets (test configs), standardizing
transaction pool API and approach to deprecate SELFDESTRUCT
Discussions on SSZ in block header, CL minimal presets (test configs), standardizing
* builder-specs v0.3.0 : add Capella support
builder-specs v0.3.0 : add Capella support
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* KZG Ceremony: 47,000+ contributors , 4000+ in the lobby, 23 days left in first
general contribution period Coinbase adds call to action to their products
KZG Ceremony:
* 47,000+ contributors , 4000+ in the lobby, 23 days left in first general contribution
period
47,000+ contributors , 4000+ in the lobby, 23 days left in first general contribution
* Coinbase adds call to action to their products
Coinbase adds call to action to their products
* Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence : blobs to be decoupled
from blocks
Latest EIP4844 implementers call video . Notes from Terence : blobs to be decoupled
* SSZ breakout video call : discussion on Union vs normalized transaction
representation, plan to prototype in next 2 weeks to decide approach to take
SSZ breakout video call : discussion on Union vs normalized transaction representation,
plan to prototype in next 2 weeks to decide approach to take
Layer 1
* Visualization of MEV-boost block flow from builder to validator via relayer
Visualization of MEV-boost block flow from builder to validator via relayer
* Flashbots: design for MEV-Share , users send transactions to a matchmaker to match
with searchers who pay users for using their transactions
Flashbots: design for MEV-Share , users send transactions to a matchmaker to match with
searchers who pay users for using their transactions
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.4.3 : Zhejiang testnet support, fix for dropping peers
Prysm v3.2.1 : Capella upgrade for Sepolia testnet Teku v23.2.0 : early access to
doppelganger detection and Capella upgrade for Sepolia testnet
Consensus layer:
* Lodestar v1.4.3 : Zhejiang testnet support, fix for dropping peers
Lodestar v1.4.3 : Zhejiang testnet support, fix for dropping peers
* Prysm v3.2.1 : Capella upgrade for Sepolia testnet
Prysm v3.2.1 : Capella upgrade for Sepolia testnet
* Teku v23.2.0 : early access to doppelganger detection and Capella upgrade for Sepolia
testnet
Teku v23.2.0 : early access to doppelganger detection and Capella upgrade for Sepolia
* Execution layer: Besu v23.1.0 : move to Java 17 LTS, performance improvements &
Bonsai robustness Geth v1.11.0 : Shanghai upgrade support, added Pebble database as
LevelDB replacement (requires resync), removed puppeth & mobile development libraries
and deprecated personal RPC namespace; v1.11.1 : patch for empty block processing in
Shanghai upgrade Nethermind v1.17.0 : Shanghai upgrade for Sepolia testnet &
performance improvements
Execution layer:
* Besu v23.1.0 : move to Java 17 LTS, performance improvements & Bonsai robustness
Besu v23.1.0 : move to Java 17 LTS, performance improvements & Bonsai robustness
* Geth v1.11.0 : Shanghai upgrade support, added Pebble database as LevelDB replacement
(requires resync), removed puppeth & mobile development libraries and deprecated
personal RPC namespace; v1.11.1 : patch for empty block processing in Shanghai upgrade
Geth v1.11.0 : Shanghai upgrade support, added Pebble database as LevelDB replacement
* Nethermind v1.17.0 : Shanghai upgrade for Sepolia testnet & performance improvements
Nethermind v1.17.0 : Shanghai upgrade for Sepolia testnet & performance improvements
Research
* Censorship resistance using delayed reveal, forward inclusion lists or parallel
auctions
For Stakers
* Jim McDonald: withdrawals explainer and changing withdrawal credentials
Jim McDonald: withdrawals explainer and changing withdrawal credentials
* Guide to preparing a voluntary exit message in advance of scenarios such as death or
stolen/lost node
Guide to preparing a voluntary exit message in advance of scenarios such as death or
Layer 2
* zkEVMs race to be first to mainnet: zkSync Era (zkSync v2) opens project onboarding
before alpha launch Polygon zkEVM announce beta launch on March 27
zkEVMs race to be first to mainnet:
* zkSync Era (zkSync v2) opens project onboarding before alpha launch
zkSync Era (zkSync v2) opens project onboarding before alpha launch
* Polygon zkEVM announce beta launch on March 27
Polygon zkEVM announce beta launch on March 27
* Optimism delays Bedrock upgrade vote to resolve issues from bounty contest
Optimism delays Bedrock upgrade vote to resolve issues from bounty contest
* Coinbase finally adds send & receive for ETH & DAI on Arbitrum
Coinbase finally adds send & receive for ETH & DAI on Arbitrum
* Patrick McCorry: decentralizing a rollup needs to ensure one honest party can send
all potential decisions to the contract bridge when the system is under attack by an
adversary
Patrick McCorry: decentralizing a rollup needs to ensure one honest party can send all
potential decisions to the contract bridge when the system is under attack by an
* EF Layer 2 grants round recipients , $948k to 22 projects
EF Layer 2 grants round recipients , $948k to 22 projects
EIPs/Standards
* ERCs: ERC6498 : Document signing for contracts ERC6506 : P2P escrowed governance
incentives
* ERC6498 : Document signing for contracts
ERC6498 : Document signing for contracts
* ERC6506 : P2P escrowed governance incentives
ERC6506 : P2P escrowed governance incentives
This newsletter is made possible thanks to SpeedRunEthereum !
Test your skills and learn how to build apps on Ethereum at SpeedRunEthereum.com .
Stuff for developers
* Foundry: forge-std v1.4.0 : invariant test helpers included by default, Create2
helpers and flag to disable fallback to default public RPC Guide to invariant testing
with Foundry, example using WETH ignore Solidity warnings with the ignored_error_codes
config option organize unit tests using a state tree
Foundry:
* forge-std v1.4.0 : invariant test helpers included by default, Create2 helpers and
flag to disable fallback to default public RPC
forge-std v1.4.0 : invariant test helpers included by default, Create2 helpers and flag
to disable fallback to default public RPC
* Guide to invariant testing with Foundry, example using WETH
Guide to invariant testing with Foundry, example using WETH
* ignore Solidity warnings with the ignored_error_codes config option
ignore Solidity warnings with the ignored_error_codes config option
* organize unit tests using a state tree
organize unit tests using a state tree
* Seaport v1.3 : zone checks after token transfers fix, prevent filtering native tokens
& more efficient bulk listings
Seaport v1.3 : zone checks after token transfers fix, prevent filtering native tokens &
more efficient bulk listings
* NFT Exponential Dutch Auction (NFTEDA) Solidity for exponential price decay
NFT Exponential Dutch Auction (NFTEDA) Solidity for exponential price decay
* Alchemy: walk through of an account abstraction design , explains why ERC4337 is so
complex
Alchemy: walk through of an account abstraction design , explains why ERC4337 is so
* Solhint v3.4.0 : adds rules for named parameters in mappings and banning console.sol
& global imports
Solhint v3.4.0 : adds rules for named parameters in mappings and banning console.sol &
global imports
* Solplate : generate boilerplate Solidity contract using Rust script
Solplate : generate boilerplate Solidity contract using Rust script
* Fe language bounty challenges : two challenges added
Fe language bounty challenges : two challenges added
* Guide to using SMTLIB2 representation of a contract with an SMT Solver
Guide to using SMTLIB2 representation of a contract with an SMT Solver
* samczsun’s ABI Tools : decode/encode transaction data
samczsun’s ABI Tools : decode/encode transaction data
* ABI Data : API to fetch & cache contract ABI’s from Etherscan
ABI Data : API to fetch & cache contract ABI’s from Etherscan
* Quix NFT marketplace open sourced , Next.js/React frontend and Django backend
Quix NFT marketplace open sourced , Next.js/React frontend and Django backend
* yGenius : connecting a knowledge base to GPT using gpt_index library
yGenius : connecting a knowledge base to GPT using gpt_index library
* Yuga Labs Dookey Dash skill-based mint game cheats and bots
Yuga Labs Dookey Dash skill-based mint game cheats and bots
Security
* Dexible $1.5m exploit , approved tokens could be transferred
Dexible $1.5m exploit , approved tokens could be transferred
* dForcenet funds returned after exploiter’s IP & device info identified
dForcenet funds returned after exploiter’s IP & device info identified
* Balancer Merkle Orchard logic error disclosed , $3.2m was at risk, 50 ETH bounty paid
Balancer Merkle Orchard logic error disclosed , $3.2m was at risk, 50 ETH bounty paid
* Beanstalk logic error disclosed , $3.1m was at risk, $181k bounty paid
Beanstalk logic error disclosed , $3.1m was at risk, $181k bounty paid
* SCSVS v2 : updated contract security checklist
SCSVS v2 : updated contract security checklist
Ecosystem
* Half of blocks were from non-censoring relays
Enterprise
* Starlight v1 zApp transpiler
Starlight v1 zApp transpiler
* Baseline Profile architecture explainer
Baseline Profile architecture explainer
Application layer
* NFT marketplaces: Blur airdrop caused surge in gas prices Blur updated creator
royalty policy to enforce full royalties only if OpenSea blocked OpenSea dropped fees
to zero (for an unspecified time) and made royalties optional (0.5% minimum) unless
on-chain enforced, marketplaces with the same policies won’t be blocked
NFT marketplaces:
* Blur airdrop caused surge in gas prices
Blur airdrop caused surge in gas prices
* Blur updated creator royalty policy to enforce full royalties only if OpenSea blocked
Blur updated creator royalty policy to enforce full royalties only if OpenSea blocked
* OpenSea dropped fees to zero (for an unspecified time) and made royalties optional
(0.5% minimum) unless on-chain enforced, marketplaces with the same policies won’t be
blocked
OpenSea dropped fees to zero (for an unspecified time) and made royalties optional
* Overtime (sports markets) expands to Arbitrum
Overtime (sports markets) expands to Arbitrum
* UMA oSnap : DAOs can execute off-chain Snapshot voting using UMA’s optimistic oracle
UMA oSnap : DAOs can execute off-chain Snapshot voting using UMA’s optimistic oracle
* RabbitHole v2 (learn to earn): users complete quests & mint tradable NFTs to claim
rewards
RabbitHole v2 (learn to earn): users complete quests & mint tradable NFTs to claim
Job Listings
* Certora is hiring a Senior Enterprise Sales Rep .
Certora is hiring a Senior Enterprise Sales Rep .
* Cyfrin.io is hiring senior security engineers $190k-$300k.
Cyfrin.io is hiring senior security engineers $190k-$300k.
* Shell Protocol team is hiring senior Solidity devs & more , remote or Hawaii
Shell Protocol team is hiring senior Solidity devs & more , remote or Hawaii
* Request Network is hiring a Community & Communication Manager
Request Network is hiring a Community & Communication Manager
* Community Lead for ethereum.org sought by Ethereum Foundation
Community Lead for ethereum.org sought by Ethereum Foundation
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable in ETH/DAI/USDC to
abcoathup.eth on mainnet or Layer 2. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* US SEC: Terraform Labs & Do Kwon charged with securities fraud Paxos issued with
Wells notice claiming BUSD is a security Blockchain Association filed amicus brief for
SEC claims that 9 tokens are securities in alleged insider trading lawsuit proposal for
investment advisers to custody assets only with qualified custodians , Commissioner
Peirce concerned for impact on crypto ex-NBA player Paul Pierce charged for token
promotion without disclosing payment & making misleading statements
US SEC:
* Terraform Labs & Do Kwon charged with securities fraud
Terraform Labs & Do Kwon charged with securities fraud
* Paxos issued with Wells notice claiming BUSD is a security
Paxos issued with Wells notice claiming BUSD is a security
* Blockchain Association filed amicus brief for SEC claims that 9 tokens are securities
in alleged insider trading lawsuit
Blockchain Association filed amicus brief for SEC claims that 9 tokens are securities
* proposal for investment advisers to custody assets only with qualified custodians ,
Commissioner Peirce concerned for impact on crypto
proposal for investment advisers to custody assets only with qualified custodians ,
* ex-NBA player Paul Pierce charged for token promotion without disclosing payment &
making misleading statements
ex-NBA player Paul Pierce charged for token promotion without disclosing payment &
* New York Department of Financial Services ordered Paxos to stop minting BUSD
New York Department of Financial Services ordered Paxos to stop minting BUSD
* Alex Pertsev remains in jail in the Netherlands, next hearing in late April
Alex Pertsev remains in jail in the Netherlands, next hearing in late April
General/crypto
* Zero-value token transfer phishing attacks (poison transactions)
Zero-value token transfer phishing attacks (poison transactions)
* Ordinals (Bitcoin NFTs) using Emblem Vault to trade on Ethereum via OpenSea
Ordinals (Bitcoin NFTs) using Emblem Vault to trade on Ethereum via OpenSea
* Apple WebKit 0-day , malicious web content could lead to arbitrary code execution
Apple WebKit 0-day , malicious web content could lead to arbitrary code execution
* NameCheap third party email gateway was sending phishing email
NameCheap third party email gateway was sending phishing email
* Sangria : folding scheme for PLONK
Sangria : folding scheme for PLONK
* Why zk-rollups are advantaged over alt-zk L1s
Why zk-rollups are advantaged over alt-zk L1s
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-february-18-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Feb 24 - Mar 1 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek
Feb 24 - Mar 1 – ETHDenver BUIDLWeek
* Feb 27 – deadline for EF academic grants round
Feb 27 – deadline for EF academic grants round
* Feb 28 – Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella
Feb 28 – Sepolia testnet upgrades to Shapella
* Mar 2-5 – ETHDenver Hackathon
Mar 2-5 – ETHDenver Hackathon
* Mar 10-29 – Scaling Ethereum (ETHGlobal) virtual
Mar 10-29 – Scaling Ethereum (ETHGlobal) virtual
* Mar 15-16 – ETHDubai
Mar 15-16 – ETHDubai
* Mar 16-18 – ETH Porto
Mar 16-18 – ETH Porto
* Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio
Mar 28-30 – Ethereum Rio
* Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC
Apr 12-14 – NFT NYC
* Apr 14-16 – ETHGlobal Tokyo
Apr 14-16 – ETHGlobal Tokyo
* Apr 14-16 – ETHZurich conference & hackathon
Apr 14-16 – ETHZurich conference & hackathon
* Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference
Apr 21-25 – EthTaipei hackathon & conference
* Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon
Apr 27-30 – Istanbul ETH Privacy conference & hackathon
* May 5-7 – ETHMalaysia conference & hackathon
May 5-7 – ETHMalaysia conference & hackathon
* May 5-7 – ETHTallinn hackathon
May 5-7 – ETHTallinn hackathon
* May 9-10 – NFT Tallinn conference
May 9-10 – NFT Tallinn conference
* May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
May 19-23 – EDCON Montenegro (changed from Vienna)
* May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
May 20-21 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
* May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
May 24-26 – Spaghett ETH (Naples) conference
* May 26–28 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
May 26–28 – ETHGlobal Istanbul
* Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
Jun 2-4 – ETH Seoul
* Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Toronto
Jun 23–25 – ETHGlobal Toronto
* Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
Jul 5-7 – ETHBarcelona
* Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
* Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
Jul 21–23 – ETHGlobal Paris
* Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
Aug 16-19 – Ethereum Argentina (Buenos Aires)
* Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
Sep 22–24 – ETHGlobal New York
* Oct 6–25 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
Oct 6–25 – ETHOnline (ETHGlobal) virtual
